title: Subway worker mocks Asian customer and tells her ‘speak f***ing English’
text:
The worker recorded the incident on his own Snapchat (Picture: MEN) A Subway worker has been fired after he was caught on camera racially abusing a customer.
In shocking footage, the staff member at the sandwich chain’s Cheetham Hill store in Manchester, berates the woman in front of her friends.
British teenager, 18, dies after falling from mast of yacht in Jamaica Mocking her Asian accent, the man – who recorded the incident on his own Snapchat – can be heard shouting at the customer.
At one point, he is recorded saying: ‘Speak f English.’
He then added: ‘I’ve just put you on Snapchat, you dumb b****, get the f*** out.
‘Dumb b****. Get out, man.’
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
He racially abused the customer (Picture: MEN) The first clip, taken at the store on Bury Old Road, is accompanied with the caption ‘work life’.
Later in the footage, the woman points at three male workers behind the counter, calling them ‘three sensible men’.
Couple jailed for selling 10 dying puppies to people The member of staff filming her then says: ‘Three sensible men and one dumb b .’
Later in the video, he shouts at the woman: ‘Tell me again for the snap.’
As the woman continues to try to talk to the member of staff, he says: ‘We don’t understand that s*** round here, yo.
‘Speak f English.’
He has been fired since the incident (Picture: MEN) The worker then puts on an offensive mock Asian accent and says: ‘Get the f*** out of my shop.’
Subway bosses confirmed yesterday that the store’s franchisee carried out an investigation and the member of staff has since been sacked.
'There's no plan' if aliens visit, says MOD's former UFO expert A spokeswoman said: ‘Subway does not condone or tolerate discriminatory behaviour of any kind.
‘The Subway franchisee of this store conducted a thorough investigation into this incident and the employee involved has been dismissed.
‘Subway franchisees set high standards for all of their employees – and any breaches of these standards are taken very seriously.’
The footage has been passed to Greater Manchester Police.
